text: #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Here's @RonRyckman announcing the vote on the Medicaid expansion bill, HB 2066. #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Kansas House approves Medicaid expansion bill, 69-54. Twenty-eight Republicans broke with their leaders' opposition to join the 41 Democrats in supporting it. https://bit.ly/2U1sBZH  #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Here's the story about the ex-president. https://www.apnews.com/8f1c023d391e44eb887b3284b4626862 … #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Ex-President George W. Bush scores hole-in-one on Dallas golf course. My late Dad had seven in a lifetime that included decades of golf and visits to famed Augusta National, Pebble Beach and the Old Course at St. Andrews. Today would have been his 86th birthday. #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: As noted on #ksleg, the federal Hyde Amendment bans Medicaid funding of abortion, except when necessary to save a woman's life or in cases of rape and incest. Those exceptions are not present in the House provision.
author: APjdhanna

text: The House also added a provision saying that the expansion "shall not provide coverage or reimbursement for any reimbursement services." The amendment passed 90-34. #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: And that's already been hotly debated on #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: The other key change imposes a $25-per-month premium for each person covered by the expansion, with a cap of $100-per-month for families. Kelly's plan had allowed a premium, capped at 2 percent of person's income. #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text:
The House did add two significant modifications of Kelly's plan. One is a tougher "poison pill" saying expansion would end within a year if the federal government stopped funding 90 percent of the costs. Here's an earlier story on that issue. 
 https://bit.ly/2EW1HsC  #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Update: Houses votes 70-54 to give first-round approval to Medicaid expansion bill, advancing it with bipartisan support over GOP leaders' objections. https://bit.ly/2Cup7VM  #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Supporters of Medicaid expansion show they have enough votes to pass a bill through the Kansas House with a 69-53 vote to add plan from @GovLauraKelly to health care bill. House debate continues. https://bit.ly/2Cup7VM  #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Kansas House is debating Medicaid expansion, with supporters forcing a debate on plan from @GovLauraKelly. #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: More on @GovLauraKelly's withdrawn nominee for the Kansas Court of Appeals. He now faces questions about whether he should remain on the bench in Labette County. And there are new legal questions about whether the governor can name a new nominee. https://bit.ly/2OdGFdw  #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Update: @SenatorWagle says conduct of Judge Jeffry Jack, whose  political tweets sunk his Kansas Court of Appeals nomination, should be reviewed by the state commission on judicial ethics. She says she is considering filing a complaint herself. https://bit.ly/2UKYy5N  #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Here's the full text of Judge Jeffry Jack's statement. #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Update: Ex-Court of Appeals nominee defends tweets as personal opinions that don't influence his work on as a trial-court judge; Kansas for Life calls on him to step down from district court; a legal battle may be brewing over the next nomination. #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: @GovLauraKelly has withdrawn her nomination of Jeffry Jack, Labette County district judge, to the state Court of Appeals. #ksleg https://www.apnews.com/a63dc869cb044d05b9706aba8dd860f9 …
author: APjdhanna

text: @SenatorWagle on Court of Appeals nomination: "It will fail, there's no question," in the Senate. "Americans are very upset with activist, political judges." #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: Problems with Court of Appeals nominee arise a day after @KDOTHQ says an employee who used an official account to send a tweet critical of @realDonaldTrump  no longer works for the agency. https://bit.ly/2W6TyJ5  #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: @GovLauraKelly nomination of judge for KS Court of Appeals appears doomed after @SenatorWagle and another key GOP senator decry social media posts criticizing @realDonaldTrump, favoring gun control and abortion rights and knocking GOP legislators. https://bit.ly/2TWbfxx  #ksleg
author: APjdhanna

text: @GovLauraKelly nominates Labette County District Judge Jeffry Jack for the Kansas Court of Appeals. Jack, a judge since 2005 and a former Kansas House member, would replace retired Judge Patrick McAnany. His appointment requires Senate confirmation. https://bit.ly/2T8i0aT  #ksleg
author: APjdhanna
